result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI 5th Offense and Operating w/ PAC - 5th Offense. The defendant was found guilty of OWI 5th Offense and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC - 5th Offense was dismissed by the court.

  • Lee R Namtvedt was found guilty of OWI 5th Offense, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence, including Barron County Case 10CF102.

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Consecutive to: any other sentence, including Barron County Case 10CF102

records.addlTxt: of Plea Hearing held on October 3, 2022.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
10:35 AM Defendant Lee R Namtvedt appeared by video, in custody from Oak Hill Correctional.  Attorney Elizabeth Jean Smith appeared by video for Lee R Namtvedt.  Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to appear in person. The parties have an agreement. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1: OWI 5th. Priors as related to this charge are acknowledged. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders:
1 year 6 months Initial Confinement with 3 years of Extended Supervision consecutive to Extended Supervision in Barron County Case 10CF102 or/and any other sentence. 

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
36 month driver's license revocation
36 month IID
AODA and follow through with recommendations
$600 fine and costs and blood draw surcharge
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in or merged as appropriate.

Defendant is eligible for CAP and SIP. 
0 Credit

9:24 AM Defendant Lee R Namtvedt appeared by video from Oak Hill Correction. Attorney Elizabeth Smith appeared via Zoom.  Attorney Robert Stoiber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. There is not an agreement at this time. Defense requests a status conference.

A status conference is scheduled for 8/17/22 at 9:15 AM.
Same as Complaint just adding Count 2: Operating w/ PAC - 5th Offense.

Defense requests adjournment. Defendant waives right to personal appearance. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 4 Judicial Assistant.
